description.en:
In the first episode of the Entry Point podcast, we talk about popular web technologies Next.js and Reactโwhy these tools are good choices for getting started and building modern apps.
Then we go to the analysis and review of two startup ideas:
๐ง DISC - a tool for analyzing user behavior
๐ฅ VEO 3 - the third generation of interactive videos
If you are interested in the world of software development, startups and ideation, this episode is a good starting point to join us.

title.en: From system design to the future of programming - Freelance on Upwork

description.en:
In the second part of the "Entry Point" podcast, we discuss three interesting and practical topics:
System Design: What exactly is system design and why do large companies need it for scalability and design coordination?
How to get projects from Upwork?: Experiences and strategies for success in getting freelance projects, building a strong profile, and increasing your dollar income.
The future of programming: what skills will be most needed in the future? What will be the role of artificial intelligence in changing the style of programming?
This episode is a combination of experience, education, and foresight for today's and tomorrow's developers.

title.en: How to do Code Review like a professional? | AI for developers

description.en:
๐ The third episode of the entry point podcast
In this episode, we are going to talk about a vital skill in the world of software engineering:
How to do a professional Code Review?
We also introduce new tools that make programming faster and smarter with the help of artificial intelligence. In the following, we will go to some interesting startup ideas that may inspire your next project!

description.en:
Keywords
conversation, immigration, startup, technology, Canada, life, internet, challenges, success, entrepreneurship, immigration, business, organizational culture, feedback, resume, interview, technical skills, investment, risk, artificial intelligence
Summary
This conversation explores life experiences in Canada, immigration challenges, and startup opportunities. New technologies and challenges related to them are also mentioned. Finally, future hopes and aspirations in the world of entrepreneurship are discussed. This conversation examines the challenges of immigration, starting a business, organizational culture, feedback in the workplace, interview and presentation skills, employment challenges and technical skills, investment and risk in the Iranian market, and the impact of artificial intelligence on the labor market.
Takeaways
Living in Canada has its own challenges.
Internet in Canada may be unstable.
Migration requires careful planning.
Startups are an opportunity for innovation and growth.
Experience working with new technologies is very valuable.
It is interesting to compare the past and present conditions of startups.
The future of entrepreneurship is always promising.
Effort and perseverance is the key to success.
Geographical limitations should not hinder progress.
Hope for the future and efforts to achieve goals are essential. Immigrating and starting a business anywhere has its own challenges.
Comparing with others can hinder progress.
Storytelling can be more interesting than comparison.
Trying and starting is the key to success in any field.
Getting feedback from others can help improve performance.
Resume writing is a separate and important skill.
Investing in the Iranian market is associated with certain risks.
Artificial intelligence will have a great impact on the future of the labor market.
Presentation and communication skills are very important in career success.
Recruitment challenges in the Iranian market need attention and new solutions.
Titles
Living in Canada: Challenges and Opportunities
Immigration and Startups: A New Journey
Soundbites
"Everywhere has a series of difficulties"
"Getting feedback from others is important"
"Presentation is an important skill"

description.en:
Keywords
podcast, immigration, artificial intelligence, startup, mental health, technology, Iranian society, personal experiences, innovation, consulting, demography, diversity, women's rights, work experience, mental health, sports, technology, artificial intelligence
Summary
This conversation examines the challenges and experiences of immigration, technological developments and their effects on daily life, as well as Iranian innovations abroad. The hosts also mention social and mental health challenges and finally address personal development and counseling in the workplace. This discussion examines demographics and diversity in the industry, challenges of women's rights and benefits, the effect of experience and work history on income, technology and mental health, the effect of sports on job performance, new trends and their social effects, and the future of artificial intelligence and human interactions.
Takeaways
Scheduling challenges in podcasts can be problematic.
Migration experiences can lead to social challenges.
Technological developments have profound effects on everyday life.
Advances in artificial intelligence can revolutionize various industries.
Iranian startups are growing abroad.
Mental health challenges exist in immigrant communities.
Personal development and counseling are important in the workplace.
New projects can lead to international collaborations.
The social and cultural effects of immigration on Iranian society are significant.
Foresight about challenges and opportunities is essential. Demographics and diversity in the industry have a large impact on performance.
Women in the industry face challenges with less rights and benefits.
Experience and work history can significantly affect earnings.
Technology can help improve mental health.
Exercise has a positive effect on job performance and mental health.
New trends can have profound social effects.
Artificial intelligence can change human interactions.
Paying attention to mental health in the workplace is essential.
Personal experiences can help improve working conditions.
The future of artificial intelligence needs careful investigation and analysis.

description.en:
Australia, immigration, artificial intelligence, labor market, software, knowledge management, career challenges, personal experiences, software development, new tools, education, immigration, management, technology, software development, framework, job opportunities, experience, leadership, work
Summary
This conversation explores Ramin's personal and professional experiences in Australia. He talks about the challenges of living in Australia, the differences between the labor market in this country and Iran, and the role of artificial intelligence in the software industry. Also, his experiences of immigration and knowledge management in Iran are also discussed. This discussion examines the educational and work experiences in Iran and the challenges of immigration. Highlights include the importance of real-world experience versus a degree, management and leadership challenges in the workplace, and choosing the right frameworks for software development. Also, the conversation addresses career opportunities and career paths in the IT world.
Takeaways
Living in Australia has its own challenges.
The differences between the labor market in Australia and Iran are significant.
Artificial intelligence plays an important role in the software industry.
Knowledge management in Iran is facing challenges.
My personal experiences of immigration were very instructive.
New tools facilitate software development.
The future of artificial intelligence will affect the labor market.
Software development requires collaboration and management.
Migration challenges can create new opportunities.
Our experiences can help others. Real experience is more important than degrees.
Immigration is a positive point in life.
Project management requires segregation of duties.
Choosing the right framework is very important.
Software development requires continuous learning.
Job opportunities should be accompanied by real experience.
Team management requires communication skills.
Work experience is the best teacher.
Software development should be in line with market needs.
Project management should be based on team capacity.
Titles
Living in Australia: Challenges and Opportunities
Career experiences in Australia and Iran
Soundbites
"Real experience is more important than degrees."
"Work experience is the best teacher."
"Immigration is a positive point in life."

title.en: Entry Point Podcast - Episode 10, How to Build the Educational Future of Disadvantaged Adolescents? Interview with Shadi Mohsoum

description.en:
Taraz, online education, educational platform, students, Iran, educational challenges, technology, families, social cooperation, the future of education, free education, online education, cooperation culture, educational challenges, technology in education, the role of the family, learning, change and progress, access to education, educational psychology
Summary
This talk examines the Taraz educational platform and its goals in providing free education to students. Shadi Mahjoumi, the founder of Taraz, shares his experiences in the field of educational challenges and the role of families in students' learning. Also, the discussion examines the need for changes in the education system and the role of technology in access to education. This discussion examines the challenges and opportunities of free and online education. The most important topics include the psychological effects of free education, the role of families in learning, and the culture of cooperation in Iran. It also mentions the challenges of holding online classes and the importance of technology in education.
Takeaways
Taraz is a free educational platform for students.
Taraz's goal is to provide access to educational resources for everyone.
Education is the right of every individual and should be free.
Technology can help improve education.
The role of families in the education of students is very important.
Educational challenges in Iran need attention.
Social cooperation can contribute to the development of Taraz.
The future of Taraz depends on social cooperation.
We must look for new solutions in education.
Changes in the education system are necessary. Free education can lead to psychological challenges.
Access to education must be provided in a fair manner.
Linking strong people can help improve the education system.
Moving towards change requires cooperation and collective effort.
The role of families in online education is very important.
The culture of cooperation in Iran can help progress.
The challenges of holding online classes require creative solutions.
Technology can help improve the learning process.
Education should focus on practical skills.
Cooperation and helping each other is essential in the education system.
Titles
Taraz: a new educational platform
Challenges of online education in Iran
Soundbites
"Education is the right of every individual."
"Free education and its challenges"
"Moving towards change and progress"
Chapters

title.en: Entry Point Podcast - Episode 12, Is Joe AI Over? Using MCPs and interview stories

description.en:
๐ Description and summary of the episode
In this episode of the entry point podcast (episode 12), Ehsan and Ali got together again after a short break to chat about the latest trends in the world of programming and startups. From work experiences in large companies and the concept of increasing Velocity for engineering teams to the hot discussion of MCP (Model Context Protocol), using Cursor, AI in software development, startups without programmers (Vibe Coding) and even the risks and benefits of this new wave of artificial intelligence.
We talk about MongoDB MCP, using MCP for different tools like Slack, Jira, GitHub and how to connect them to artificial intelligence models.
๐น We look at real experiences of hiring in the era of AI, the role of junior developers, and the fascinating story of technical interviews by coding with AI.
๐น Finally, we take a look at new startups like Lovable and V0.dev, which create all the back-end and front-end with the help of AI.

title.en: Entry Point Podcast - Episode 13, Old Code Review, Engineering Structure Review, and HonoJS Overview

description.en:
* Old code migration challenges and software engineering experiences *
In this episode of the podcast, two software engineers discuss their experiences and challenges from the past week. The main topics of this talk include migration of legacy code, strategies for solving complex problems, software team structure, project management, and new trends in software development.
๐ก *Key points of this episode:*
Facing the challenges of legacy code migration requires careful strategies
A deep understanding of existing systems is essential to successful migration
The role of Senior Engineers and Principal is vital in the growth of the team
Test writing, code quality and the coexistence of old and new codes reduce project risk
New frameworks and cloud technologies (Cloudflare Workers, Lambda and Edge Computing) can improve team and project performance.
Experience and continuous learning are the key success factors in software engineering
๐ง *Why is it important to listen to this episode?*
If you're interested in software development, managing complex projects, and improving team performance, this episode is full of real-world experiences and practical advice that can make your career path faster and more secure.
๐ *Seasons:*

In this episode of the "Entry Point" podcast, we talked to Sepehr Hadaeqnia - about his career path in business, product management and startup development, the role of data in decision-making, and how artificial intelligence is changing the way work and teams work.
Sepehr talked about his experiences abroad, the challenges of working as a Product Manager and the impact of tools such as ChatGPT and Notion on the work process.

title.en: Entry Point Podcast - Episode 15, From Remote Work to Startup Success: Alireza Bashiri on Artificial Intelligence

description.en:
Join Ehsan, Ali and his guest, Alireza Bashiri, to discuss the path of building startups, using artificial intelligence tools and living independently of location. From work experience in Amsterdam and Singapore to launching AI projects like Adworthy.ai and Astro MVP, Alireza shares valuable tips on career growth, product validation and building real MVPs.
This section is for founders, developers and those interested in remote work and entrepreneurship. It is full of practical tips and inspiring stories.
What you will learn in this section:
How to optimize your startup MVP
Using artificial intelligence for project automation and growth
Life lessons from working abroad
Product validation solutions before scaling
Tips for working with founders and clients

title.en: Entry Point Podcast - Episode 16, Marketing, Attention Economy and Ethics of Platforms: Ebrahim Barzegari

description.en:
In this episode, the host, Ehsan Gazer, hosts a deep and free conversation with Ebrahim Barzegari about what marketing is in the age of data, the economy of attention and the ethical consequences of algorithms. Ebrahim gives practical examples from his research and experience: from free trial tests in the product to how to design systems that engage users unconsciously. The conversation revolves between economic analysis, psychology of decision-making and technical and organizational solutions.
00:00:00 - Introduction, start of conversation and check-in of guests
00:03:00 - What is marketing? Definition of value, production process to customer
00:07:00 - Data-driven experiments: free trial example and practical implications
00:12:00 - Attention economy: algorithms, optimization and psychological consequences
00:20:00 - Extreme Competition and Tragedy of the Commons โ When the Market Hurts Itself
00:26:00 - User manipulation, public awareness and the role of regulations/standards
00:36:00 - Ethical solutions and models: empowering users and non-manipulative businesses
00:48:00 - Artificial intelligence agents and virtual characters; The Future of Human CommunicationโSummary and Conclusion
โข New definition of marketing and value creation in the data era
โข Product tests and free trial examples to increase conversion and retention
โข The economy of attention and the effect of algorithms on the mental health and behavior of users
โข The issue of extreme competition and Tragedy of the Commons in production and consumption
โข Perception manipulation (framing) and algorithmic techniques to motivate users
โข Ethical solutions for businesses: standards, transparency and user empowerment
โข The future of artificial intelligence agents, virtual personalities and the limitations of replacing human communication

title.en: Entry Point Podcast - Episode 17, The New Wave of Artificial Intelligence Tools and the Future of Work: Robotex and Resume Writing

description.en:
In this episode, the host, Ehsan Ghazar, talks with Ali Parvizi about the latest developments in the world of technology and its consequences for developers and the labor market. From hands-on experience with new development tools like Cursor and Composer to comparing models and discussing user experience and problem solving with new versions of language modelsโall are covered in this intimate talk.
Here's a look at the week's big events: Amazon's recent layoffs and their impact on the ecosystem, developments at Robotex (Waymo and competitors) and Nvidia's investment, Canva's new vector and video editing capabilities, and the rise of smart browsers and search services like Perplexity/Comet. The final part of the episode deals with more sensitive issues; From privacy in AI tools and remote control of robots to how to change human resources recruitment processes and practical tips for writing an effective resume in the age of AI.
If you're active in software development or interested in the future of work and AI tools, this episode is full of practical examples, personal experiences, and practical advice. Subscribe to support the podcast, share your thoughts on social media, and be sure to write if you have any questions or topics for future episodes.
00:00 - Start of the episode โ a brief overview of the topics
01:00 - Composer & Cursor โ Coding with AI (Developer Tools)
03:20 - ChatGPT-5 vs other models โ where do they perform better?
04:15 - Layoffs of 14,000 people at Amazon โ consequences for the labor market
07:00 - Waymo and robotaxis โ the future of autonomous transportation (Robotics)
12:00 - Canva and turning the browser into an editing studio (Video & Vector)
15:00 - Jules from Google โ Coding Agents and Automation
19:00 - Perplexity / Comet โ Will AI search replace Google?
28:00 - Client-side Intelligent AI โ personalization, privacy and user experience
40:30 - Recruiting in the Age of AI โ Resume writing and AI tools for interviewing
โข AI-powered coding tools โ Composer, Cursor and hands-on experience
โข Comparison of language models and their application in problem solving and UI
โข Amazon layoffs and the impact on the tech job market
โข Robotex and self-driving taxis; The role of Nvidia and the future of transportation
โข Canva's evolution in video and vector editing with AI
โข Smart browsers and search services (Perplexity/Comet) and privacy concerns
โข the impact of AI on the recruitment process; Interview tools, resume optimization and practical tips

title.en: Living and Working in Australia vs Netherlands: Career Insights with Niloufar Mokhzani

description.en:
In this episode, the host talks with Niloufar Mokhzani about the experience of living and working in Australia and comparing it with the Netherlands. Niloufar discusses cultural and social differences in the workplace, how managers interact, and the impact of these differences on job comfort and productivity, sharing real examples from her daily work life.

Another part of the conversation is dedicated to the job market, job competition, techniques for success in technical interviews, and the role of resumes and cover letters. Niloufar also talks about the importance of networking, developing soft and technical skills, and how to use AI tools in recruitment processes. This episode will be useful for developers, immigration applicants, and anyone looking for practical tips for success in technical interviews and adapting to international work culture.

title.en: AI Implementation in Large Companies: Solution Architect Insights with Hossein Jadidi from Malaysia
title.fa: ูพุงุฏูโุณุงุฒ ููุด ูุตููุน ุฏุฑ ุดุฑฺฉุชโูุง ุจุฒุฑฺฏ: ุจูุดโูุง Solution Architect ุจุง ุญุณู ุฌุฏุฏ ุงุฒ ูุงูุฒ

description.en:
In this episode, we sit down with Hossein Jadidi from Malaysia to discuss practical experiences of implementing AI projects in large companies. Hossein shares his career path from Business Intelligence and full-stack development to his role as Solution Architect at Petronas and currently as Principal Architect at a SaaS company (immigrated to Malaysia in 2012 and entered the job market in 2015). His experiences include fraud detection projects, image processing, synthetic data generation, and designing LLM-based solutions.

The main discussion revolves around technical and organizational challenges: from problems integrating LLMs into sensitive systems like billing (serialization issues and errors) to testing challenges, controlling hallucinations, and managing stakeholders and resources. Hossein explains tools and platforms like Outsystems, Power Apps, Azure Foundry, OpenRouter, and new concepts like agentic AI and agent orchestration, reviewing real examples from projects like fraud detection in healthcare.

If you want to know how a Solution Architect operates in large organizations, how they manage MVP and budget, and what risks exist in launching AI, this episode is for you. Have questions? Write in the comments or send us a message through podcast channelsโHossein and we would be happy to answer and plan future episodes with topics you want.
